description:
The axis labels show the number for each tick.

For more live examples on label options, see xAxis.labels in the Highcharts API.

children.name: align
children.description: What part of the string the given position is anchored to. If left, the left side of the string is at the axis position. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right". Defaults to an intelligent guess based on which side of the chart the axis is on and the rotation of the label.

samples.name: Left-aligned labels on a vertical category axis

children.name: autoRotation
children.description: For horizontal axes, the allowed degrees of label rotation to prevent overlapping labels. If there is enough space, labels are not rotated. As the chart gets narrower, it will start rotating the labels -45 degrees, then remove every second label and try again with rotations 0 and -45 etc. Set it to false to disable rotation, which will cause the labels to word-wrap if possible.

children.name: autoRotationLimit
children.description: When each category width is more than this many pixels, we don't apply auto rotation. Instead, we lay out the axis label with word wrap. A lower limit makes sense when the label contains multiple short words that don't extend the available horizontal space for each label.

children.name: distance
children.description: Polar charts only. The label's pixel distance from the perimeter of the plot area.

children.name: enabled
children.description: Enable or disable the axis labels.

children.name: format
children.description: A format string for the axis label.

samples.name: Add units to Y axis label

children.name: formatter
children.description:
Callback JavaScript function to format the label. The value is given by this.value. Additional properties for this are axis, chart, isFirst and isLast. The value of the default label formatter can be retrieved by calling this.axis.defaultLabelFormatter.call(this) within the function.

Defaults to:

function() {
    return this.value;
}

children.name: maxStaggerLines
children.description: Horizontal axis only. When staggerLines is not set, maxStaggerLines defines how many lines the axis is allowed to add to automatically avoid overlapping X labels. Set to 1 to disable overlap detection.

children.name: overflow
children.description: How to handle overflowing labels on horizontal color axis. If set to "allow", it will not be aligned at all. By default it "justify" labels inside the chart area. If there is room to move it, it will be aligned to the edge, else it will be removed.

children.name: padding
children.description: The pixel padding for axis labels, to ensure white space between them.

children.name: position3d
children.description:
Defines how the labels are be repositioned according to the 3D chart orientation.

  • 'offset': Maintain a fixed horizontal/vertical distance from the tick marks, despite the chart orientation. This is the backwards compatible behavior, and causes skewing of X and Z axes.

  • 'chart': Preserve 3D position relative to the chart. This looks nice, but hard to read if the text isn't forward-facing.

  • 'flap': Rotated text along the axis to compensate for the chart orientation. This tries to maintain text as legible as possible on all orientations.

  • 'ortho': Rotated text along the axis direction so that the labels are orthogonal to the axis. This is very similar to 'flap', but prevents skewing the labels (X and Y scaling are still present).

children.name: reserveSpace
children.description:
Whether to reserve space for the labels. By default, space is reserved for the labels in these cases:

  • On all horizontal axes.
  • On vertical axes if label.align is right on a left-side axis or left on a right-side axis.
  • On vertical axes if label.align is center.

This can be turned off when for example the labels are rendered inside the plot area instead of outside.

samples.name: No reserved space, labels inside plot
Left-aligned labels on a vertical category axis

children.name: rotation
children.description: Rotation of the labels in degrees.

children.name: skew3d
children.description:
If enabled, the axis labels will skewed to follow the perspective.

This will fix overlapping labels and titles, but texts become less legible due to the distortion.

The final appearance depends heavily on labels.position3d.

children.name: staggerLines
children.description: Horizontal axes only. The number of lines to spread the labels over to make room or tighter labels.

children.name: step
children.description:
To show only every n'th label on the axis, set the step to n. Setting the step to 2 shows every other label.

By default, the step is calculated automatically to avoid overlap. To prevent this, set it to 1. This usually only happens on a category axis, and is often a sign that you have chosen the wrong axis type.

Read more at Axis docs => What axis should I use?

samples.name: Showing only every other axis label on a categorized x-axis
Auto steps on a category axis

children.name: style
children.description:
CSS styles for the label. Use whiteSpace: 'nowrap' to prevent wrapping of category labels. Use textOverflow: 'none' to prevent ellipsis (dots).

In styled mode, the labels are styled with the .highcharts-axis-labels class.

children.name: useHTML
children.description: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

children.name: x
children.description: The x position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis.

samples.name: Y axis labels placed on grid lines

children.name: y
children.description: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. The default makes it adapt to the font size on bottom axis.

samples.name: Y axis labels placed on grid lines

children.name: zIndex
children.description: The Z index for the axis labels.
